perturbation.original_text: Before you open the Franchise and during any Term of this Agreement, you must maintain in force, under policies of insurance written on an occurrence basis issued by carriers with an A.M. Best rating of A-VIII or better approved by us, and in such amounts as we may determine from time to time: (1) comprehensive public, professional, product, medical malpractice and motor vehicle liability insurance against claims for bodily and personal injury, death and property damage caused by or occurring in conjunction with the operation of the Franchise or otherwise in conjunction with your conduct of the Franchise Business pursuant to this Agreement, under one or more policies of insurance containing minimum liability coverage amounts as set forth in the Operations Manual; (2) general casualty insurance, including theft, cash theft, fire and extended coverage, vandalism and malicious mischief insurance, for the replacement value of the Franchise and its contents, and any other assets of the Franchise; (3) worker's compensation and employer's liability insurance as required by law, with limits equal to or in excess of those required by statute; (4) business interruption insurance for a period adequate to reestablish normal business operations, but in any event not less than six (6) months; (5) any other insurance required by applicable law, rule, regulation, ordinance or licensing requirements; and (6) umbrella liability coverage with limits of not less than $1,000,000/$3,000,000 or such other amounts that we may establish in the Operations Manual.
perturbation.changed_text: Before you open the Franchise and during any Term of this Agreement, you must maintain in force, under policies of insurance issued by carriers approved by us, and in such amounts as we may determine from time to time: (1) public liability insurance against claims for injury, death and property damage caused by or occurring in conjunction with the operation of the Franchise or otherwise in conjunction with your conduct of the Franchise Business pursuant to this Agreement; (2) general casualty insurance, including fire, for the replacement value of the Franchise and its contents; (3) worker's compensation insurance as required by law; (4) business interruption insurance; (5) any other insurance required by applicable law; and (6) umbrella liability coverage.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'comprehensive', 'professional', 'product', 'medical malpractice', 'motor vehicle liability insurance', the A.M. Best rating requirement, the 'minimum liability coverage amounts as set forth in the Operations Manual', and specific time limits for business interruption coverage significantly weakens the insurance requirement and removes key protections for both the franchisee and third parties. This creates a legal contradiction with state laws that mandate specific minimum coverage amounts and types of insurance for businesses, particularly those providing healthcare services, as this franchise does. Furthermore, specifying to only include worker's compensation insurance as required by law removes additional insurance such as employer's liability insurance which can be seen as a consumer and worker protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state but may include general business insurance requirements, worker's compensation laws, and specific requirements for healthcare providers.

perturbation.original_text: You must provide us with copies of policies evidencing the existence of such insurance concurrently with execution of this Agreement and prior to each subsequent renewal date of each insurance policy, along with certificates evidencing such insurance. You are responsible for any and all claims, losses or damages, including to third persons, originating from, in connection with, or caused by your failure to name us as an additional insured on each insurance policy. You agree to defend, indemnify and hold us harmless of, from, and with respect to any such claims, loss or damage arising out of your failure to name us as additional insured, which indemnity shall survive the termination or expiration and non-renewal of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: You must provide us with evidence of such insurance. You are responsible for any claims, losses or damages originating from your failure to name us as an additional insured on each insurance policy. You agree to indemnify and hold us harmless of, from, and with respect to any such claims, loss or damage arising out of your failure to name us as additional insured.
perturbation.explanation: The deletion of 'copies of policies evidencing the existence of such insurance concurrently with execution of this Agreement and prior to each subsequent renewal date of each insurance policy, along with certificates evidencing such insurance' and 'to defend' removes important compliance measures, making it more difficult for the franchisor to verify that the franchisee is maintaining the required insurance coverage and to have active participation in the claims.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state but relates to duty of care, negligence, and insurance requirements for businesses.

perturbation.original_text: Each insurance policy must name us (and, if we so request, our members, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates) as additional insureds, and must provide us with thirty (30) days' advance written notice of any material modification, cancellation, or expiration of the policy. Deductibles must be in reasonable amounts, and are subject to review and written approval by us.
perturbation.changed_text: Each insurance policy must name us as additional insureds. Deductibles are subject to our approval.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of '(and, if we so request, our members, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates)', 'must provide us with thirty (30) days' advance written notice of any material modification, cancellation, or expiration of the policy' and 'Deductibles must be in reasonable amounts, and are subject to review and written approval by us' weakens the control of the franchisor on the insurance, and it removes the need for those potentially insured for the insurance to be insured.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state, breach of contract, and insurance laws
